House File 622 - Introduced


                                 HOUSE FILE 

                                 HOUSE FILE 
                                 HOUSE FILE                                  HOUSE FILE                                  BY  COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND
                                     MEANS

                                 (SUCCESSOR TO HSB 190)

 A BILL FOR

  1 An Act providing for the establishment of first=time homebuyer
  2    savings accounts in Iowa, including related individual
  3    income tax exemptions, and including applicability
  4    provisions.
  5 BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE STATE OF IOWA:
    TLSB 2280HV (3) 87
    mm/rj

PAG LIN



  1  1    Section 1.  Section 422.7, Code 2017, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3                                         MEANS

  1  3        TLSB 2280HV (3) 87
    mm/rj

PAG LIN



  1  1    Section 1.  Section 422.7, Code 2017, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3        mm/rj

PAG LIN



  1  1    Section 1.  Section 422.7, Code 2017, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3    

  1  1    Section 1.  Section 422.7, Code 2017, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3    
  1  1    Section 1.  Section 422.7, Code 2017, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3      1  1    Section 1.  Section 422.7, Code 2017, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3      1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3      1  3      1  4 paragraph "b", subtract the sum of the following amounts:
  1  5    (1)  The amount of contributions made by an account holder
  1  6 during the tax year to the account holder's first=time
  1  7 homebuyer savings accounts, not to exceed the following annual
  1  8 limit:
  1  9    (a)  (i)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 10 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, four
  1 11 thousand dollars.
  1 12    (ii)  For any other account holder, two thousand dollars.
  1 13    (b)  For the tax year beginning in the 2018 calendar year
  1 14 and for each subsequent tax year, the director shall multiply
  1 15 each dollar amount set forth in subparagraph subdivisions (i)
  1 16 and (ii) by the latest cumulative inflation factor, shall
  1 17 round off the resulting product to the nearest one dollar,
  1 18 and shall incorporate the result into the income tax forms
  1 19 and instructions for each tax year.  For purposes of this
  1 20 subparagraph division, "cumulative inflation factor" means the
  1 21 product of the annual inflation factor for the 2018 calendar
  1 22 year and all annual inflation factors for subsequent calendar
  1 23 years as determined by section 422.4, subsection 1, paragraph
  1 24 "a".  The cumulative inflation factor applies to all tax years
  1 25 beginning on or after January 1 of the calendar year for
  1 26 which the latest annual inflation factor has been determined.
  1 27 Notwithstanding any other provision, the annual inflation
  1 28 factor for the 2018 calendar year is one hundred percent.
  1 29    (2)  To the extent included, income from interest received
  1 30 from the account holder's first=time homebuyer savings
  1 31 accounts.
  1 32    b.  (1)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not exceed
  1 33 the following aggregate lifetime limit:
  1 34    (a)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 35 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, an
  2  1 amount equal to the product of the deductible amount determined
  2  2 for the year in paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph
  2  3 division (a), subparagraph subdivision (i), multiplied by ten.
  2  4    (b)  For any other account holder, an amount equal to the
  2  5 product of the deductible amount determined for the year in
  2  6 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph division (a),
  2  7 subparagraph subdivision (ii), multiplied by ten.
  2  8    (2)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not be allowed to
  2  9 an account holder upon one of the following dates, whichever
  2 10 occurs first:
  2 11    (a)  January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes
  2 16 other than the payment or reimbursement of the designated
  2 17 beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with a
  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during
  2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      1  5    (1)  The amount of contributions made by an account holder
  1  6 during the tax year to the account holder's first=time
  1  7 homebuyer savings accounts, not to exceed the following annual
  1  8 limit:
  1  9    (a)  (i)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 10 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, four
  1 11 thousand dollars.
  1 12    (ii)  For any other account holder, two thousand dollars.
  1 13    (b)  For the tax year beginning in the 2018 calendar year
  1 14 and for each subsequent tax year, the director shall multiply
  1 15 each dollar amount set forth in subparagraph subdivisions (i)
  1 16 and (ii) by the latest cumulative inflation factor, shall
  1 17 round off the resulting product to the nearest one dollar,
  1 18 and shall incorporate the result into the income tax forms
  1 19 and instructions for each tax year.  For purposes of this
  1 20 subparagraph division, "cumulative inflation factor" means the
  1 21 product of the annual inflation factor for the 2018 calendar
  1 22 year and all annual inflation factors for subsequent calendar
  1 23 years as determined by section 422.4, subsection 1, paragraph
  1 24 "a".  The cumulative inflation factor applies to all tax years
  1 25 beginning on or after January 1 of the calendar year for
  1 26 which the latest annual inflation factor has been determined.
  1 27 Notwithstanding any other provision, the annual inflation
  1 28 factor for the 2018 calendar year is one hundred percent.
  1 29    (2)  To the extent included, income from interest received
  1 30 from the account holder's first=time homebuyer savings
  1 31 accounts.
  1 32    b.  (1)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not exceed
  1 33 the following aggregate lifetime limit:
  1 34    (a)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 35 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, an
  2  1 amount equal to the product of the deductible amount determined
  2  2 for the year in paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph
  2  3 division (a), subparagraph subdivision (i), multiplied by ten.
  2  4    (b)  For any other account holder, an amount equal to the
  2  5 product of the deductible amount determined for the year in
  2  6 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph division (a),
  2  7 subparagraph subdivision (ii), multiplied by ten.
  2  8    (2)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not be allowed to
  2  9 an account holder upon one of the following dates, whichever
  2 10 occurs first:
  2 11    (a)  January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes
  2 16 other than the payment or reimbursement of the designated
  2 17 beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with a
  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during
  2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      1  6 during the tax year to the account holder's first=time

  1  8 limit:

  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      1  8 limit:
  1  9    (a)  (i)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 10 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, four
  1 11 thousand dollars.
  1 12    (ii)  For any other account holder, two thousand dollars.
  1 13    (b)  For the tax year beginning in the 2018 calendar year

  1 15 each dollar amount set forth in subparagraph subdivisions (i)

  1 28 factor for the 2018 calendar year is one hundred percent.
  1 29    (2)  To the extent included, income from interest received
  1 30 from the account holder's first=time homebuyer savings
  1 31 accounts.
  1 32    b.  (1)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not exceed
  1 33 the following aggregate lifetime limit:
  1 34    (a)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and

  2  1 amount equal to the product of the deductible amount determined

  2  5 product of the deductible amount determined for the year in
  2  6 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph division (a),
  2  7 subparagraph subdivision (ii), multiplied by ten.
  2  8    (2)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not be allowed to
  2  9 an account holder upon one of the following dates, whichever
  2 10 occurs first:
  2 11    (a)  January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes
  2 16 other than the payment or reimbursement of the designated
  2 17 beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with a
  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during
  2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      1  9    (a)  (i)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 10 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, four
  1 11 thousand dollars.
  1 12    (ii)  For any other account holder, two thousand dollars.
  1 13    (b)  For the tax year beginning in the 2018 calendar year
  1 14 and for each subsequent tax year, the director shall multiply
  1 15 each dollar amount set forth in subparagraph subdivisions (i)
  1 16 and (ii) by the latest cumulative inflation factor, shall
  1 17 round off the resulting product to the nearest one dollar,
  1 18 and shall incorporate the result into the income tax forms
  1 19 and instructions for each tax year.  For purposes of this
  1 20 subparagraph division, "cumulative inflation factor" means the
  1 21 product of the annual inflation factor for the 2018 calendar
  1 22 year and all annual inflation factors for subsequent calendar
  1 23 years as determined by section 422.4, subsection 1, paragraph
  1 24 "a".  The cumulative inflation factor applies to all tax years
  1 25 beginning on or after January 1 of the calendar year for
  1 26 which the latest annual inflation factor has been determined.
  1 27 Notwithstanding any other provision, the annual inflation
  1 28 factor for the 2018 calendar year is one hundred percent.
  1 29    (2)  To the extent included, income from interest received
  1 30 from the account holder's first=time homebuyer savings
  1 31 accounts.
  1 32    b.  (1)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not exceed
  1 33 the following aggregate lifetime limit:
  1 34    (a)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 35 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, an
  2  1 amount equal to the product of the deductible amount determined
  2  2 for the year in paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph
  2  3 division (a), subparagraph subdivision (i), multiplied by ten.
  2  4    (b)  For any other account holder, an amount equal to the
  2  5 product of the deductible amount determined for the year in
  2  6 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph division (a),
  2  7 subparagraph subdivision (ii), multiplied by ten.
  2  8    (2)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not be allowed to
  2  9 an account holder upon one of the following dates, whichever
  2 10 occurs first:
  2 11    (a)  January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes
  2 16 other than the payment or reimbursement of the designated
  2 17 beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with a
  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during
  2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.

  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during
  2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      1 15 each dollar amount set forth in subparagraph subdivisions (i)
  1 16 and (ii) by the latest cumulative inflation factor, shall
  1 17 round off the resulting product to the nearest one dollar,
  1 18 and shall incorporate the result into the income tax forms
  1 19 and instructions for each tax year.  For purposes of this
  1 20 subparagraph division, "cumulative inflation factor" means the
  1 21 product of the annual inflation factor for the 2018 calendar
  1 22 year and all annual inflation factors for subsequent calendar
  1 23 years as determined by section 422.4, subsection 1, paragraph
  1 24 "a".  The cumulative inflation factor applies to all tax years
  1 25 beginning on or after January 1 of the calendar year for
  1 26 which the latest annual inflation factor has been determined.
  1 27 Notwithstanding any other provision, the annual inflation
  1 28 factor for the 2018 calendar year is one hundred percent.
  1 29    (2)  To the extent included, income from interest received
  1 30 from the account holder's first=time homebuyer savings
  1 31 accounts.
  1 32    b.  (1)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not exceed
  1 33 the following aggregate lifetime limit:
  1 34    (a)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 35 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, an
  2  1 amount equal to the product of the deductible amount determined
  2  2 for the year in paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph
  2  3 division (a), subparagraph subdivision (i), multiplied by ten.
  2  4    (b)  For any other account holder, an amount equal to the
  2  5 product of the deductible amount determined for the year in
  2  6 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph division (a),
  2  7 subparagraph subdivision (ii), multiplied by ten.
  2  8    (2)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not be allowed to
  2  9 an account holder upon one of the following dates, whichever
  2 10 occurs first:
  2 11    (a)  January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes
  2 16 other than the payment or reimbursement of the designated
  2 17 beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with a
  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during

  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home

  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).

  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the

  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be

  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.

  1 34    (a)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 35 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, an
  2  1 amount equal to the product of the deductible amount determined
  2  2 for the year in paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph
  2  3 division (a), subparagraph subdivision (i), multiplied by ten.
  2  4    (b)  For any other account holder, an amount equal to the
  2  5 product of the deductible amount determined for the year in
  2  6 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph division (a),
  2  7 subparagraph subdivision (ii), multiplied by ten.
  2  8    (2)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not be allowed to
  2  9 an account holder upon one of the following dates, whichever
  2 10 occurs first:
  2 11    (a)  January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes
  2 16 other than the payment or reimbursement of the designated
  2 17 beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with a
  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during
  2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      1 22 year and all annual inflation factors for subsequent calendar
  1 23 years as determined by section 422.4, subsection 1, paragraph
  1 24 "a".  The cumulative inflation factor applies to all tax years
  1 25 beginning on or after January 1 of the calendar year for
  1 26 which the latest annual inflation factor has been determined.
  1 27 Notwithstanding any other provision, the annual inflation
  1 28 factor for the 2018 calendar year is one hundred percent.
  1 29    (2)  To the extent included, income from interest received
  1 30 from the account holder's first=time homebuyer savings
  1 31 accounts.
  1 32    b.  (1)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not exceed
  1 33 the following aggregate lifetime limit:
  1 34    (a)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 35 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, an
  2  1 amount equal to the product of the deductible amount determined
  2  2 for the year in paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph
  2  3 division (a), subparagraph subdivision (i), multiplied by ten.
  2  4    (b)  For any other account holder, an amount equal to the
  2  5 product of the deductible amount determined for the year in
  2  6 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph division (a),
  2  7 subparagraph subdivision (ii), multiplied by ten.
  2  8    (2)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not be allowed to
  2  9 an account holder upon one of the following dates, whichever
  2 10 occurs first:
  2 11    (a)  January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes

  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same

  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately

  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.

  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      1 29    (2)  To the extent included, income from interest received
  1 30 from the account holder's first=time homebuyer savings
  1 31 accounts.
  1 32    b.  (1)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not exceed
  1 33 the following aggregate lifetime limit:
  1 34    (a)  For married taxpayers who file a joint return and
  1 35 maintain a joint first=time homebuyer savings account, an
  2  1 amount equal to the product of the deductible amount determined
  2  2 for the year in paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph
  2  3 division (a), subparagraph subdivision (i), multiplied by ten.
  2  4    (b)  For any other account holder, an amount equal to the
  2  5 product of the deductible amount determined for the year in
  2  6 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph division (a),
  2  7 subparagraph subdivision (ii), multiplied by ten.
  2  8    (2)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not be allowed to
  2  9 an account holder upon one of the following dates, whichever
  2 10 occurs first:
  2 11    (a)  January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes
  2 16 other than the payment or reimbursement of the designated
  2 17 beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with a
  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during
  2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.

  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account

  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately

  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.

  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      2  2 for the year in paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph
  2  3 division (a), subparagraph subdivision (i), multiplied by ten.
  2  4    (b)  For any other account holder, an amount equal to the
  2  5 product of the deductible amount determined for the year in
  2  6 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), subparagraph division (a),
  2  7 subparagraph subdivision (ii), multiplied by ten.
  2  8    (2)  The subtraction in paragraph "a" shall not be allowed to
  2  9 an account holder upon one of the following dates, whichever
  2 10 occurs first:
  2 11    (a)  January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes
  2 16 other than the payment or reimbursement of the designated
  2 17 beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with a
  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during
  2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.

  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      2 12 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 13 homebuyer savings account.
  2 14    (b)  The date on which funds within an account holder's
  2 15 first=time homebuyer savings account are withdrawn for purposes
  2 16 other than the payment or reimbursement of the designated
  2 17 beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with a
  2 18 qualified home purchase.  Any amount transferred between
  2 19 different first=time homebuyer savings accounts of the same
  2 20 account holder by a person other than the account holder
  2 21 shall not be considered a withdrawal for purposes of this
  2 22 subparagraph division (b).
  2 23    c.  (1)  Add, to the extent previously deducted under
  2 24 paragraph "a", subparagraph (1), the amount withdrawn during
  2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.

  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      2 25 the tax year from an account holder's first=time homebuyer
  2 26 savings account for purposes other than the payment or
  2 27 reimbursement of the designated beneficiary's eligible home
  2 28 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  2 29    (2)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", any amount remaining
  2 30 in an account holder's first=time homebuyer savings account
  2 31 on January 1 of the tenth calendar year after the calendar
  2 32 year during which the account holder first opened a first=time
  2 33 homebuyer savings account shall be considered immediately
  2 34 withdrawn under subparagraph (1).
  2 35    (3)  For purposes of this paragraph "c", the transfer of
  3  1 amounts between different first=time homebuyer accounts of the
  3  2 same account holder by a person other than the account holder
  3  3 shall not cause such transfer to be considered a withdrawal
  3  4 under subparagraph (1).
  3  5    d.  For any amount considered a withdrawal required to be
  3  6 added to net income pursuant to paragraph "c", the account
  3  7 holder shall be assessed a penalty equal to ten percent of
  3  8 the amount of the withdrawal.  The penalty shall not apply
  3  9 to withdrawals made by reason of the death of the account
  3 10 holder, or to withdrawals made pursuant to a garnishment,
  3 11 levy, or other order, including but not limited to an order in
  3 12 bankruptcy following a filing for protection under the federal
  3 13 bankruptcy code, 11 U.S.C. {101 et seq.
  3 14    e.  For purposes of this subsection, "account holder",
  3 15 "designated beneficiary", "eligible home costs", "first=time
  3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.

  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      3 16 homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home purchase" mean
  3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      3 17 the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      3 18    Sec. 2.  Section 422.9, subsection 2, Code 2017, is amended
  3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      3 19 by adding the following new paragraph:
  3 20      3 20      3 21 miscellaneous expenses deductible for federal income tax
  3 22 purposes to the extent such amounts are eligible home costs
  3 23 in connection with a qualified home purchase that were paid
  3 24 or reimbursed from funds in a first=time homebuyer savings
  3 25 account.  For purposes of this paragraph, "eligible home costs",
  3 26 "first=time homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home
  3 27 purchase" mean the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 28    Sec. 3.    3 22 purposes to the extent such amounts are eligible home costs
  3 23 in connection with a qualified home purchase that were paid
  3 24 or reimbursed from funds in a first=time homebuyer savings
  3 25 account.  For purposes of this paragraph, "eligible home costs",
  3 26 "first=time homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home
  3 27 purchase" mean the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 28    Sec. 3.    3 23 in connection with a qualified home purchase that were paid
  3 24 or reimbursed from funds in a first=time homebuyer savings
  3 25 account.  For purposes of this paragraph, "eligible home costs",
  3 26 "first=time homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home
  3 27 purchase" mean the same as defined in section 541B.2.

  3 25 account.  For purposes of this paragraph, "eligible home costs",

  3 27 purchase" mean the same as defined in section 541B.2.

  3 26 "first=time homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home
  3 27 purchase" mean the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 28    Sec. 3.    3 26 "first=time homebuyer savings account", and "qualified home
  3 27 purchase" mean the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 28    Sec. 3.    3 27 purchase" mean the same as defined in section 541B.2.
  3 28    Sec. 3.    3 28    Sec. 3.    3 29    This chapter may be cited as the "Iowa First=Time Homebuyer
  3 30 Savings Account Act".
  3 31    Sec. 4.    3 30 Savings Account Act".
  3 31    Sec. 4.    3 31    Sec. 4.    3 32    As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise
  3 33 requires:
  3 34    1.  "Account holder" means an individual who establishes,
  3 35 either individually or jointly with the individual's spouse,
  4  1 a first=time homebuyer savings account pursuant to section
  4  2 541B.3.
  4  3    2.  "Department" means the department of revenue.
  4  4    3.  "Designated beneficiary" means an individual meeting the
  4  5 requirements of section 541B.3, subsection 2, and designated
  4  6 by an account holder as beneficiary of the account holder's
  4  7 first=time homebuyer savings account pursuant to section
  4  8 541B.3, subsection 2.
  4  9    4.  a.  "Eligible home costs" means the following:
  4 10    (1)  The down payment for the purchase of a single=family
  4 11 residence in Iowa by a designated beneficiary.
  4 12    (2)  A cost, fee, tax, or payment incurred by, or charged
  4 13 or assigned to, a designated beneficiary for the purchase of a
  4 14 single=family residence in Iowa, and listed on the statement
  4 15 of receipts and disbursements for the sale, including any
  4 16 statement prescribed by 12 C.F.R. {1026.38, as amended.
  4 17    b.  "Eligible home costs" includes any United States veterans
  4 18 administration funding fee incurred by, or charged or assigned
  4 19 to, a designated beneficiary in connection with a veterans
  4 20 administration home loan guaranty program.
  4 21    5.  "Financial institution" means a state or federally
  4 22 chartered bank, savings and loan association, credit union, or
  4 23 trust company in this state.
  4 24    6.  "First=time homebuyer" means an individual who is a
  4 25 resident of Iowa and who does not own, either individually or
  4 26 jointly, a single=family or multifamily residence, and who
  4 27 has not owned or purchased, either individually or jointly, a
  4 28 single=family or multifamily residence for a period of three
  4 29 years prior to all of the following:
  4 30    a.  The date on which the individual is named as a designated
  4 31 beneficiary of a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  4 32    b.  The date of the qualified home purchase for which the
  4 33 eligible home costs are paid or reimbursed from a first=time
  4 34 homebuyer savings account.
  4 35    7.  "First=time homebuyer savings account" means an account
  5  1 that meets the requirements of sections 541B.3 and 541B.4 and
  5  2 that was established for the purpose of paying or reimbursing a
  5  3 designated beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with
  5  4 a qualified home purchase.
  5  5    8.  "Individual" means a natural person.
  5  6    9.  "Qualified home purchase" means, with respect to a
  5  7 first=time homebuyer savings account, the purchase of a
  5  8 single=family residence in Iowa by the account's designated
  5  9 beneficiary ninety or more days after the date the account
  5 10 holder first opened a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  5 11    10.  "Resident" means the same as defined in section 422.4.
  5 12    11.  "Single=family residence" means a single=family
  5 13 residence owned and occupied by a designated beneficiary as the
  5 14 designated beneficiary's principal residence, including but not
  5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,
  5 16 or cooperative.
  5 17    Sec. 5.    3 33 requires:
  3 34    1.  "Account holder" means an individual who establishes,
  3 35 either individually or jointly with the individual's spouse,
  4  1 a first=time homebuyer savings account pursuant to section
  4  2 541B.3.
  4  3    2.  "Department" means the department of revenue.
  4  4    3.  "Designated beneficiary" means an individual meeting the
  4  5 requirements of section 541B.3, subsection 2, and designated
  4  6 by an account holder as beneficiary of the account holder's
  4  7 first=time homebuyer savings account pursuant to section
  4  8 541B.3, subsection 2.

  5 17    Sec. 5.    4  5 requirements of section 541B.3, subsection 2, and designated
  4  6 by an account holder as beneficiary of the account holder's
  4  7 first=time homebuyer savings account pursuant to section
  4  8 541B.3, subsection 2.
  4  9    4.  a.  "Eligible home costs" means the following:
  4 10    (1)  The down payment for the purchase of a single=family
  4 11 residence in Iowa by a designated beneficiary.
  4 12    (2)  A cost, fee, tax, or payment incurred by, or charged
  4 13 or assigned to, a designated beneficiary for the purchase of a
  4 14 single=family residence in Iowa, and listed on the statement
  4 15 of receipts and disbursements for the sale, including any
  4 16 statement prescribed by 12 C.F.R. {1026.38, as amended.
  4 17    b.  "Eligible home costs" includes any United States veterans
  4 18 administration funding fee incurred by, or charged or assigned
  4 19 to, a designated beneficiary in connection with a veterans
  4 20 administration home loan guaranty program.
  4 21    5.  "Financial institution" means a state or federally
  4 22 chartered bank, savings and loan association, credit union, or
  4 23 trust company in this state.
  4 24    6.  "First=time homebuyer" means an individual who is a
  4 25 resident of Iowa and who does not own, either individually or
  4 26 jointly, a single=family or multifamily residence, and who
  4 27 has not owned or purchased, either individually or jointly, a
  4 28 single=family or multifamily residence for a period of three
  4 29 years prior to all of the following:
  4 30    a.  The date on which the individual is named as a designated
  4 31 beneficiary of a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  4 32    b.  The date of the qualified home purchase for which the
  4 33 eligible home costs are paid or reimbursed from a first=time
  4 34 homebuyer savings account.
  4 35    7.  "First=time homebuyer savings account" means an account
  5  1 that meets the requirements of sections 541B.3 and 541B.4 and
  5  2 that was established for the purpose of paying or reimbursing a
  5  3 designated beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with
  5  4 a qualified home purchase.
  5  5    8.  "Individual" means a natural person.
  5  6    9.  "Qualified home purchase" means, with respect to a
  5  7 first=time homebuyer savings account, the purchase of a
  5  8 single=family residence in Iowa by the account's designated
  5  9 beneficiary ninety or more days after the date the account
  5 10 holder first opened a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  5 11    10.  "Resident" means the same as defined in section 422.4.
  5 12    11.  "Single=family residence" means a single=family
  5 13 residence owned and occupied by a designated beneficiary as the
  5 14 designated beneficiary's principal residence, including but not
  5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,
  5 16 or cooperative.

  5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,

  5 17    Sec. 5.    4 16 statement prescribed by 12 C.F.R. {1026.38, as amended.
  4 17    b.  "Eligible home costs" includes any United States veterans
  4 18 administration funding fee incurred by, or charged or assigned
  4 19 to, a designated beneficiary in connection with a veterans
  4 20 administration home loan guaranty program.
  4 21    5.  "Financial institution" means a state or federally
  4 22 chartered bank, savings and loan association, credit union, or
  4 23 trust company in this state.
  4 24    6.  "First=time homebuyer" means an individual who is a
  4 25 resident of Iowa and who does not own, either individually or
  4 26 jointly, a single=family or multifamily residence, and who
  4 27 has not owned or purchased, either individually or jointly, a
  4 28 single=family or multifamily residence for a period of three
  4 29 years prior to all of the following:
  4 30    a.  The date on which the individual is named as a designated
  4 31 beneficiary of a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  4 32    b.  The date of the qualified home purchase for which the
  4 33 eligible home costs are paid or reimbursed from a first=time
  4 34 homebuyer savings account.
  4 35    7.  "First=time homebuyer savings account" means an account
  5  1 that meets the requirements of sections 541B.3 and 541B.4 and
  5  2 that was established for the purpose of paying or reimbursing a
  5  3 designated beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with
  5  4 a qualified home purchase.
  5  5    8.  "Individual" means a natural person.
  5  6    9.  "Qualified home purchase" means, with respect to a
  5  7 first=time homebuyer savings account, the purchase of a
  5  8 single=family residence in Iowa by the account's designated
  5  9 beneficiary ninety or more days after the date the account
  5 10 holder first opened a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  5 11    10.  "Resident" means the same as defined in section 422.4.
  5 12    11.  "Single=family residence" means a single=family
  5 13 residence owned and occupied by a designated beneficiary as the
  5 14 designated beneficiary's principal residence, including but not
  5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,
  5 16 or cooperative.
  5 17    Sec. 5.    4 17    b.  "Eligible home costs" includes any United States veterans
  4 18 administration funding fee incurred by, or charged or assigned
  4 19 to, a designated beneficiary in connection with a veterans
  4 20 administration home loan guaranty program.

  5  4 a qualified home purchase.
  5  5    8.  "Individual" means a natural person.
  5  6    9.  "Qualified home purchase" means, with respect to a
  5  7 first=time homebuyer savings account, the purchase of a
  5  8 single=family residence in Iowa by the account's designated
  5  9 beneficiary ninety or more days after the date the account
  5 10 holder first opened a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  5 11    10.  "Resident" means the same as defined in section 422.4.
  5 12    11.  "Single=family residence" means a single=family
  5 13 residence owned and occupied by a designated beneficiary as the
  5 14 designated beneficiary's principal residence, including but not
  5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,
  5 16 or cooperative.
  5 17    Sec. 5.    4 33 eligible home costs are paid or reimbursed from a first=time
  4 34 homebuyer savings account.
  4 35    7.  "First=time homebuyer savings account" means an account
  5  1 that meets the requirements of sections 541B.3 and 541B.4 and
  5  2 that was established for the purpose of paying or reimbursing a
  5  3 designated beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with
  5  4 a qualified home purchase.
  5  5    8.  "Individual" means a natural person.
  5  6    9.  "Qualified home purchase" means, with respect to a
  5  7 first=time homebuyer savings account, the purchase of a
  5  8 single=family residence in Iowa by the account's designated
  5  9 beneficiary ninety or more days after the date the account
  5 10 holder first opened a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  5 11    10.  "Resident" means the same as defined in section 422.4.
  5 12    11.  "Single=family residence" means a single=family
  5 13 residence owned and occupied by a designated beneficiary as the
  5 14 designated beneficiary's principal residence, including but not
  5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,
  5 16 or cooperative.
  5 17    Sec. 5.    4 34 homebuyer savings account.
  4 35    7.  "First=time homebuyer savings account" means an account
  5  1 that meets the requirements of sections 541B.3 and 541B.4 and
  5  2 that was established for the purpose of paying or reimbursing a
  5  3 designated beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with
  5  4 a qualified home purchase.

  5 13 residence owned and occupied by a designated beneficiary as the
  5 14 designated beneficiary's principal residence, including but not
  5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,
  5 16 or cooperative.

  5 14 designated beneficiary's principal residence, including but not
  5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,
  5 16 or cooperative.
  5 17    Sec. 5.    5 14 designated beneficiary's principal residence, including but not
  5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,
  5 16 or cooperative.
  5 17    Sec. 5.    5 15 limited to a manufactured home, mobile home, condominium unit,
  5 16 or cooperative.
  5 17    Sec. 5.    5 16 or cooperative.
  5 17    Sec. 5.    5 17    Sec. 5.    5 18 account.
  5 19    1.  Establishment of account.
  5 20    a.  Beginning January 1, 2018, an individual may open an
  5 21 interest=bearing savings account with a financial institution
  5 22 and designate the entire account as a first=time homebuyer
  5 23 savings account for the purpose of paying or reimbursing a
  5 24 designated beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with
  5 25 a qualified home purchase.  The first=time homebuyer savings
  5 26 account designation shall be made no later than April 30 of the
  5 27 year following the tax year during which the account is opened,
  5 28 on forms provided by the department.
  5 29    b.  A married couple electing to file a joint Iowa individual
  5 30 income tax return may establish a joint first=time homebuyer
  5 31 savings account.  Married taxpayers electing to file separate
  5 32 tax returns or separately on a combined tax return for Iowa tax
  5 33 purposes shall not establish or maintain a joint first=time
  5 34 homebuyer savings account.
  5 35    c.  An individual may establish more than one first=time
  6  1 homebuyer savings account, provided each account has a
  6  2 different designated beneficiary.
  6  3    2.  Designation of beneficiary.
  6  4    a.  The account holder shall designate one individual as
  6  5 beneficiary of the first=time homebuyer savings account.  The
  6  6 designation shall be made on forms provided by the department
  6  7 and no later than April 30 of the year following the tax year
  6  8 during which the account is opened.  The account holder may
  6  9 change the designated beneficiary of the first=time homebuyer
  6 10 savings account at any time.
  6 11    b.  The account holder and designated beneficiary of
  6 12 a first=time homebuyer savings account may be the same
  6 13 individual.
  6 14    c.  An individual may be the designated beneficiary of more
  6 15 than one first=time homebuyer savings account.
  6 16    d.  The designated beneficiary of a first=time homebuyer
  6 17 savings account must be a first=time homebuyer.
  6 18    Sec. 6.    5 19    1.  Establishment of account.
  5 20    a.  Beginning January 1, 2018, an individual may open an
  5 21 interest=bearing savings account with a financial institution
  5 22 and designate the entire account as a first=time homebuyer
  5 23 savings account for the purpose of paying or reimbursing a
  5 24 designated beneficiary's eligible home costs in connection with
  5 25 a qualified home purchase.  The first=time homebuyer savings
  5 26 account designation shall be made no later than April 30 of the
  5 27 year following the tax year during which the account is opened,
  5 28 on forms provided by the department.

  5 31 savings account.  Married taxpayers electing to file separate
  5 32 tax returns or separately on a combined tax return for Iowa tax
  5 33 purposes shall not establish or maintain a joint first=time
  5 34 homebuyer savings account.

  6 15 than one first=time homebuyer savings account.
  6 16    d.  The designated beneficiary of a first=time homebuyer
  6 17 savings account must be a first=time homebuyer.
  6 18    Sec. 6.    5 27 year following the tax year during which the account is opened,
  5 28 on forms provided by the department.
  5 29    b.  A married couple electing to file a joint Iowa individual
  5 30 income tax return may establish a joint first=time homebuyer
  5 31 savings account.  Married taxpayers electing to file separate
  5 32 tax returns or separately on a combined tax return for Iowa tax
  5 33 purposes shall not establish or maintain a joint first=time
  5 34 homebuyer savings account.
  5 35    c.  An individual may establish more than one first=time
  6  1 homebuyer savings account, provided each account has a
  6  2 different designated beneficiary.
  6  3    2.  Designation of beneficiary.
  6  4    a.  The account holder shall designate one individual as
  6  5 beneficiary of the first=time homebuyer savings account.  The
  6  6 designation shall be made on forms provided by the department
  6  7 and no later than April 30 of the year following the tax year
  6  8 during which the account is opened.  The account holder may
  6  9 change the designated beneficiary of the first=time homebuyer
  6 10 savings account at any time.
  6 11    b.  The account holder and designated beneficiary of
  6 12 a first=time homebuyer savings account may be the same
  6 13 individual.
  6 14    c.  An individual may be the designated beneficiary of more
  6 15 than one first=time homebuyer savings account.
  6 16    d.  The designated beneficiary of a first=time homebuyer
  6 17 savings account must be a first=time homebuyer.
  6 18    Sec. 6.    5 28 on forms provided by the department.
  5 29    b.  A married couple electing to file a joint Iowa individual
  5 30 income tax return may establish a joint first=time homebuyer
  5 31 savings account.  Married taxpayers electing to file separate
  5 32 tax returns or separately on a combined tax return for Iowa tax
  5 33 purposes shall not establish or maintain a joint first=time
  5 34 homebuyer savings account.

  6 17 savings account must be a first=time homebuyer.
  6 18    Sec. 6.    6 17 savings account must be a first=time homebuyer.
  6 18    Sec. 6.    6 18    Sec. 6.    6 19 account holder responsibilities.
  6 20    1.  Account contributions.  Contributions to a first=time
  6 21 homebuyer savings account may be made by any person in the form
  6 22 of cash.  There is no limitation on the amount of contributions
  6 23 that may be made to or retained in a first=time homebuyer
  6 24 savings account.
  6 25    2.  Account expenses.  The account holder shall not use funds
  6 26 held in a first=time homebuyer savings account to pay expenses,
  6 27 if any, of administering the account, except that all fees and
  6 28 charges assessed by the financial institution may be deducted
  6 29 from the account by the financial institution where the account
  6 30 is held.
  6 31    3.  Required reports.  The account holder shall submit the
  6 32 following information to the department:
  6 33    a.  An annual report for the first=time homebuyer savings
  6 34 account on forms furnished by the department.  The report shall
  6 35 be included with the Iowa income tax return of the account
  7  1 holder.
  7  2    b.  A copy of the federal internal revenue service form
  7  3 1099, or other similar federal internal revenue service income
  7  4 reporting form, if any, issued for the first=time homebuyer
  7  5 savings account to the account holder by the financial
  7  6 institution where the account is held.  The form shall be
  7  7 included with the Iowa income tax return of the account holder.
  7  8    c.  Upon a withdrawal of funds from a first=time homebuyer
  7  9 savings account, a transaction report on forms furnished by the
  7 10 department.
  7 11    4.  Withdrawal of funds.  The account holder may withdraw
  7 12 funds from a first=time homebuyer savings account at any time.
  7 13    Sec. 7.    6 20    1.  Account contributions.  Contributions to a first=time
  6 21 homebuyer savings account may be made by any person in the form
  6 22 of cash.  There is no limitation on the amount of contributions
  6 23 that may be made to or retained in a first=time homebuyer
  6 24 savings account.
  6 25    2.  Account expenses.  The account holder shall not use funds
  6 26 held in a first=time homebuyer savings account to pay expenses,
  6 27 if any, of administering the account, except that all fees and
  6 28 charges assessed by the financial institution may be deducted
  6 29 from the account by the financial institution where the account
  6 30 is held.
  6 31    3.  Required reports.  The account holder shall submit the
  6 32 following information to the department:
  6 33    a.  An annual report for the first=time homebuyer savings
  6 34 account on forms furnished by the department.  The report shall
  6 35 be included with the Iowa income tax return of the account
  7  1 holder.

  7  5 savings account to the account holder by the financial

  7  7 included with the Iowa income tax return of the account holder.
  7  8    c.  Upon a withdrawal of funds from a first=time homebuyer
  7  9 savings account, a transaction report on forms furnished by the
  7 10 department.
  7 11    4.  Withdrawal of funds.  The account holder may withdraw
  7 12 funds from a first=time homebuyer savings account at any time.

  7  9 savings account, a transaction report on forms furnished by the
  7 10 department.
  7 11    4.  Withdrawal of funds.  The account holder may withdraw
  7 12 funds from a first=time homebuyer savings account at any time.
  7 13    Sec. 7.    6 24 savings account.
  6 25    2.  Account expenses.  The account holder shall not use funds
  6 26 held in a first=time homebuyer savings account to pay expenses,
  6 27 if any, of administering the account, except that all fees and
  6 28 charges assessed by the financial institution may be deducted
  6 29 from the account by the financial institution where the account
  6 30 is held.
  6 31    3.  Required reports.  The account holder shall submit the
  6 32 following information to the department:
  6 33    a.  An annual report for the first=time homebuyer savings
  6 34 account on forms furnished by the department.  The report shall
  6 35 be included with the Iowa income tax return of the account
  7  1 holder.
  7  2    b.  A copy of the federal internal revenue service form
  7  3 1099, or other similar federal internal revenue service income
  7  4 reporting form, if any, issued for the first=time homebuyer
  7  5 savings account to the account holder by the financial
  7  6 institution where the account is held.  The form shall be
  7  7 included with the Iowa income tax return of the account holder.
  7  8    c.  Upon a withdrawal of funds from a first=time homebuyer
  7  9 savings account, a transaction report on forms furnished by the
  7 10 department.
  7 11    4.  Withdrawal of funds.  The account holder may withdraw
  7 12 funds from a first=time homebuyer savings account at any time.
  7 13    Sec. 7.    6 25    2.  Account expenses.  The account holder shall not use funds
  6 26 held in a first=time homebuyer savings account to pay expenses,
  6 27 if any, of administering the account, except that all fees and
  6 28 charges assessed by the financial institution may be deducted
  6 29 from the account by the financial institution where the account
  6 30 is held.

  7 13    Sec. 7.    7 13    Sec. 7.    7 14 protections.
  7 15    Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to require a
  7 16 financial institution to do any of the following, or to be
  7 17 responsible or liable for any of the following:
  7 18    1.  Designate or label within the financial institution's
  7 19 account contracts, systems, or in any other manner, an account
  7 20 as a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  7 21    2.  Ascertain or verify the purpose of a withdrawal of funds
  7 22 from a first=time homebuyer savings account, or track the
  7 23 destination or use of the withdrawn funds.
  7 24    3.  Allocate funds in a first=time homebuyer savings account
  7 25 to a designated beneficiary or among joint account holders.
  7 26    4.  Report any information to the department or any other
  7 27 governmental agency.
  7 28    5.  Determine or ensure that an account satisfies the
  7 29 requirements to be a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  7 30    6.  Determine or ensure that funds withdrawn from a
  7 31 first=time homebuyer savings account are used for the payment
  7 32 or reimbursement of a designated beneficiary's eligible home
  7 33 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  7 34    7.  Report or remit taxes or penalties related to the
  7 35 ownership or use of a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  8  1    8.  Include the name of a beneficiary in the title of a
  8  2 first=time homebuyer savings account, or document the change of
  8  3 any beneficiary to a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  8  4    Sec. 8.    7 15    Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to require a
  7 16 financial institution to do any of the following, or to be
  7 17 responsible or liable for any of the following:
  7 18    1.  Designate or label within the financial institution's
  7 19 account contracts, systems, or in any other manner, an account
  7 20 as a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  7 21    2.  Ascertain or verify the purpose of a withdrawal of funds
  7 22 from a first=time homebuyer savings account, or track the
  7 23 destination or use of the withdrawn funds.
  7 24    3.  Allocate funds in a first=time homebuyer savings account
  7 25 to a designated beneficiary or among joint account holders.
  7 26    4.  Report any information to the department or any other
  7 27 governmental agency.
  7 28    5.  Determine or ensure that an account satisfies the
  7 29 requirements to be a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  7 30    6.  Determine or ensure that funds withdrawn from a
  7 31 first=time homebuyer savings account are used for the payment
  7 32 or reimbursement of a designated beneficiary's eligible home
  7 33 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  7 34    7.  Report or remit taxes or penalties related to the
  7 35 ownership or use of a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  8  1    8.  Include the name of a beneficiary in the title of a
  8  2 first=time homebuyer savings account, or document the change of
  8  3 any beneficiary to a first=time homebuyer savings account.

  7 28    5.  Determine or ensure that an account satisfies the
  7 29 requirements to be a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  7 30    6.  Determine or ensure that funds withdrawn from a
  7 31 first=time homebuyer savings account are used for the payment
  7 32 or reimbursement of a designated beneficiary's eligible home
  7 33 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  7 34    7.  Report or remit taxes or penalties related to the
  7 35 ownership or use of a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  8  1    8.  Include the name of a beneficiary in the title of a
  8  2 first=time homebuyer savings account, or document the change of
  8  3 any beneficiary to a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  8  4    Sec. 8.    7 22 from a first=time homebuyer savings account, or track the
  7 23 destination or use of the withdrawn funds.
  7 24    3.  Allocate funds in a first=time homebuyer savings account
  7 25 to a designated beneficiary or among joint account holders.
  7 26    4.  Report any information to the department or any other
  7 27 governmental agency.
  7 28    5.  Determine or ensure that an account satisfies the
  7 29 requirements to be a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  7 30    6.  Determine or ensure that funds withdrawn from a
  7 31 first=time homebuyer savings account are used for the payment
  7 32 or reimbursement of a designated beneficiary's eligible home
  7 33 costs in connection with a qualified home purchase.
  7 34    7.  Report or remit taxes or penalties related to the
  7 35 ownership or use of a first=time homebuyer savings account.

  8  2 first=time homebuyer savings account, or document the change of

  7 27 governmental agency.

  7 35 ownership or use of a first=time homebuyer savings account.

  7 35 ownership or use of a first=time homebuyer savings account.

  8  2 first=time homebuyer savings account, or document the change of

  7 35 ownership or use of a first=time homebuyer savings account.

  8  2 first=time homebuyer savings account, or document the change of
  8  3 any beneficiary to a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  8  4    Sec. 8.    7 35 ownership or use of a first=time homebuyer savings account.
  8  1    8.  Include the name of a beneficiary in the title of a
  8  2 first=time homebuyer savings account, or document the change of
  8  3 any beneficiary to a first=time homebuyer savings account.
